column4: please help! ubuntu is no longer picking up my sound card (soundblaster fatality)
if it worked in a previous release and not this one, i think you're in "file a bug" territory:  ubuntu-bug -s audio
no, because it has worked in 10.10 before...
well thats "ew" ... try booting an older kernel?
maco; does it have something to do with pulseaudio?
pulseaudio runs on top of the drivers. if you have nothing in /proc/asound/cards, thats the driver or udev or something kernel-y screwing up
Maco: i've never booted an older kernel...
hold shift during boot and use arrow keys to pick the 3rd entry instead of the first
